Trying to reopen an old ticket.

I've re-experienced the same problem from before but now I no longer see the console errors related with omnibot.

The situation happens on a linux 64bit system running the 2.72 32bit release.
I was able to reproduce the freeze while connecting to the test-server running at etlegacy.com and with a local dedicated server.
The time for the client to freeze varies but was around 30 minutes on the etlegacy.com server.

I tried to compile the latest version from git. I was able to compile the 64bit version which after a few hours of testing didn't freeze.
However this was a debug build so I'm not 100% sure if this is fixed in latest git or if not being an optimized build hides the problem.

RaFaL and spyhawk provided some guidance on IRC, including build scripts.
I was not able to compile a 32bit version due to several missing dependencies.
RaFaL was kind enough to provide one using latest git but the binaries were incompatible with my system causing a segfault immediately at execution.

So with that, I'd like to say this is indeed fixed but I'd like to try it under the same conditions, i.e. a 32bit build with same parametrization used for release of 2.72.
If you can provide this build I'd be happy to test it.
RaFal build didn't work for me either. You should try a release build of latest master (even 64 bit) and see if you can reproduce.

So reporting my attempts...

With 64bit builds I cannot reproduce the freeze. Tried both build from source and the official 2.72 release.
Tried the official 2.72 32bit build and it froze. Also tried updating omnibots to the latest available and it still froze.
Still with the 32bit build, now playing without bots, I got bored after 30 mins running around shooting walls. During this period it didn't freeze.
I'm going to try to leave the client running on its own and see if it freezes. I'll update if it does.

So summing up, it's specific to 32bits and maybe related/triggered by having bots around.
The 32bit build with debug symbols will come in handy to try to figure this out.

Sounds like #746.

Edit: sorry, did miss this was a client issue.

Well I've never had server freezes, only client. When the client freezes I can restart the client and reconnect to the same server without problems.
One more bit of info, if I run the client in window mode and launch it from a terminal I can ctrl+c the process and it exits "cleanly". I.e. next time etl starts it won't complain that it crashed before.

One more update. So leaving the client running for a few hours without input (and disabled timeouts to prevent kicking from server) it didn't freeze.
I also tried to play other mods by joining online servers and for the time I played, which was short, no freeze happened. This was with Silent mod.

I'll edit the main post to get the information together in one place.
